Issue #27 Jules II Proto 6x4 1984 T. d. Montcorgé/J. P. Nicolle

The 1984 Dakar departed from Place de la Concorde in Paris on January 1 and took competitors through France, Algeria, Niger, Upper Volta, Ivory Coast, Sierra Leone, Guinea, and finishing in Dakar, Senegal on January 20 for a total of 3,655 miles. There was no rest day so it was 20 straight days of driving!

The Jules II Proto - sponsored by the namesake Christian Dior perfume - was a 6-wheeled 4-wheel drive vehicle designed by the driver, Thierry de Montcorgé. The drivetrain consisted of a mid-mounted Chevrolet 5.7L engine developing 391 lb-ft of torque and 360hp mated to a Porsche 935 transmisson. This combination was good for a top speed of nearly 120 mph on the track. In addition, the vehicle was equipped with a special generator that allowed the use of welding and electrical equipment.

Montcorgé & Nicolle were a DNF having to withdraw due to a broken chassis.

Sources
History of Dakar - RETROSPECTIVE 1979-2007
Berlines à 6 Roues : Paris Dakar (6 Wheel Sedans: Paris Dakar)
Tamerlane's Thoughts: Jules Proto 6x4 Dakar Racer
